content:
Style Class

In this Article

Organizes style characteristics of an ASP.NET mobile control. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter(typeof(System.ComponentModel.ExpandableObjectConverter))]
[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
[System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder(typeof(System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControlBuilder))]
public class Style : ICloneable, System.Web.UI.IParserAccessor, System.Web.UI.IStateManager, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ITemplateable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • Style

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

The base Style class contains style characteristics common to all mobile controls. Classes that inherit from the Style class contain additional style characteristics specific to their associated control.

Due to the diversity of devices supported by mobile controls, all style properties are advisory, and might or might not be honored depending on the capabilities of the target device.

Constructors summary

Style()

Initializes a new instance of the Style class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Fields summary

AlignmentKey

Represents the key used to retrieve the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Alignment* setting of the Style. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
BackColorKey

The key for retrieving the style from the embedded style sheet for stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.BackColor* property. Used internally by ASP.NET. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
BoldKey

The key for retrieving the style from the embedded style sheet for setting the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo.Bold* property of the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Font*. Used internally by ASP.NET. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
FontNameKey

The key for retrieving the style from the embedded style sheet for the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo.Name* property of the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Font* property. Used internally by ASP.NET. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
FontSizeKey

The key for retrieving the style from the embedded style sheet for the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo.Size* property of the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Font* property. Used internally by ASP.NET. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
ForeColorKey

The key for retrieving the style from the embedded style sheet for the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.ForeColor* property. Used internally by ASP.NET. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
ItalicKey

The key for retrieving the style from the embedded style sheet for the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo.Italic* property of the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Font* property. Used internally by ASP.NET. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
WrappingKey

The key for retrieving the style from the embedded style sheet for stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Wrapping*. Used internally by ASP.NET. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Properties summary

Alignment

Gets or sets the specified alignment for the style. The default value is Alignment. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
BackColor

Gets or sets the specified background color for the style. The default value is Empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Control

Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
DeviceSpecific

Gets or sets the DeviceSpecific/Choice construct associated with the control. The accessor returns null if no such construct exists. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Font

Returns a FontInfo object that contains font information about the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
ForeColor

Gets or sets the specified foreground color for the style. Typically, this property sets the color for the text. The default value is Empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
IsTemplated

Gets a value indicating whether a Style object has an active template set. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
IsTrackingViewState

Gets a value indicating whether the Style object is saving changes to its view state. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Item(Object)

Returns the style through the key parameter, with or without using inheritance. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Item(Object,Boolean)

Returns the style, through the key parameter, with or without using inheritance. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Name

Gets or sets the name of the specified object. The default value is an empty string (""). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
State

Gets the current contents of the StateBag. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
StyleReference

Gets or sets a reference to the style properties for a Style. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Wrapping

Gets or sets the specified wrapping mode for the style. The default value is Wrapping. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Applies the properties of a style to a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Loads the view state into the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.State* of the Style object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
RegisterStyle(String,Type,Object,Boolean)

Registers a style property and returns a unique key for lookup. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Saves the changes to the view state to an Object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Properties

  • Alignment

    Gets or sets the specified alignment for the style. The default value is Alignment. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment Alignment { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Alignment

      An enumerated value representing the specified alignment for the style.

    Remarks

    The Alignment property can be set to any of the following values:

    Value Description
    System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment No alignment is set for the specified object.
    System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment Aligns to the left.
    System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment Aligns to the center.
    System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment Aligns to the right.
  • BackColor

    Gets or sets the specified background color for the style. The default value is Empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Drawing.Color BackColor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      The specified background color for the style.

    Remarks

    Unlike the other properties, the BackColor property is not inherited from its parent. For example, if you set the BackColor property to cyan on a parent control, a child control will not inherit a background color of cyan; you must explicitly set the child control's BackColor property to cyan, or you must set the BackColor property of the parent control and apply the style sheet to the child control. This is consistent with the behavior of cascading style sheets.

  • Control

    Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl Control { get; }

    Property Value

    • MobileControl

      A strongly typed reference to the associated control.

    Remarks

    This property returns the control that is the container for the specified style.

  • DeviceSpecific

    Gets or sets the DeviceSpecific/Choice construct associated with the control. The accessor returns null if no such construct exists. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecific DeviceSpecific { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • DeviceSpecific

      The DeviceSpecific/Choice construct associated with the control.

  • Font

    Returns a FontInfo object that contains font information about the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo Font { get; }

    Property Value

    • FontInfo

      An enumerated value specifying the font information about the control.

    Remarks

    The FontInfo class has the following properties:

    Property Description
    Bold Whether the font is bold.
    Italic Whether the font is italic.
    Name An identifier for this font instance.
    Size The font size.
  • ForeColor

    Gets or sets the specified foreground color for the style. Typically, this property sets the color for the text. The default value is Empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Drawing.Color ForeColor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      The specified foreground color for the style.

    Remarks

    You can use the ForeColor property to display text in different colors. The strings that can be used for colors are a set of fixed colors and hexadecimal RGB values. These values can also be specified as "#bb7023".

    You can also use the Microsoft Windows color constants.

  • IsTemplated

    Gets a value indicating whether a Style object has an active template set. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public bool IsTemplated { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the style has an active template set; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    To be considered templated, an object must have a <DeviceSpecific> element with a <Choice> element successfully evaluated for the target device. The selected choice must have templates defined.

  • IsTrackingViewState

    Gets a value indicating whether the Style object is saving changes to its view state. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected bool IsTrackingViewState { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the control is tracking changes to its view state; otherwise, false.

  • Item(Object)

    Returns the style through the key parameter, with or without using inheritance. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public object this[object key] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • key
      System.Object

      The key of the style to get or set.

    Property Value

    • System.Object

      The style specified by the given key.

  • Item(Object,Boolean)

    Returns the style, through the key parameter, with or without using inheritance. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public object this[object key, bool inherit] { get; }

    Parameters

    • key
      System.Object

      The key of the style to get or set.

    • inherit
      Boolean

      true to use inheritance; otherwise, false.

    Property Value

    • System.Object

      The style specified by key.

  • Name

    Gets or sets the name of the specified object. The default value is an empty string (""). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public string Name { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the specified object.

  • State

    Gets the current contents of the StateBag. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected System.Web.UI.StateBag State { get; }

    Property Value

    • StateBag

      The current contents of the StateBag object.

  • StyleReference

    Gets or sets a reference to the style properties for a Style. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public virtual string StyleReference { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A reference to the style properties for a Style object.

    Remarks

    The value of the StyleReference property must be the Name property of a Style object. You can use the StyleReference property to share styles across controls, either by using inheritance or by using the StyleReference property of a style sheet. For more information, see Styles and Creating New Styles.

  • Wrapping

    Gets or sets the specified wrapping mode for the style. The default value is Wrapping. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping Wrapping { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Wrapping

      An enumerated value that specifies the wrapping mode for the style.

    Remarks

    The following table contains the definitions of the Wrapping enumerations.

    Enumeration Value Description
    System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping 0 No size is set for the specified object. This is the default value.
    System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping 1 Wrap to the next line.
    System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping 2 The text is not wrapped to the next line.

Methods

  • AddParsedSubObject(Object)

    Sets the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.DeviceSpecific* property to the specified object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected void AddParsedSubObject (object o);

    Parameters

    • o
      System.Object

      The object to be set as the value of stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.DeviceSpecific*.

    Exceptions

    • Exception

      The stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.DeviceSpecific* property is not null.

    Remarks

    The AddParsedSubObject method does not support multiple DeviceSpecific objects and will throw an Exception if the DeviceSpecific property is not null when AddParsedSubObject is called.

  • ApplyTo(WebControl)

    Applies the properties of a style to a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public void ApplyTo (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl control);

    Parameters

    • control
      WebControl

      The control to which the style properties are applied.

    Remarks

    The following control properties are affected:

    Property Description
    Size The size of the font.
    Bold Whether the font is bold.
    Italic Whether the font is italic.
    ForeColor The foreground color.
    BackColor The background color.
  • Clone()

    Returns a copy of this instance of the Style object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public object Clone ();

    Returns

    • System.Object

      A copy of this instance of Style.

  • GetTemplate(String)

    Returns the template with the specified name. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Web.UI.ITemplate GetTemplate (string templateName);

    Parameters

    • templateName
      String

      The name of the specified template.

    Returns

    • ITemplate

      The template with the specified name.

    Remarks

    Returns null if the control is not templated, or if the template does not exist in the selected template set.

  • LoadViewState(Object)

    Loads the view state into the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.State* of the Style object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected void LoadViewState (object state);

    Parameters

    • state
      System.Object

      The object containing the view-state information.

    Remarks

    This method is used primarily by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state. For more information, see ASP.NET State Management Overview.

  • RegisterStyle(String,Type,Object,Boolean)

    Registers a style property and returns a unique key for lookup. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public static object RegisterStyle (string name, Type type, object defaultValue, bool inherit);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the style property.

    • type
      Type

      The type used for the property.

    • defaultValue
      System.Object

      The default value of the property.

    • inherit
      Boolean

      Indicates whether the style inherits from parent objects. The default is true.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      A unique key for lookup.

    Remarks

    Called only from inherited style classes.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use the RegisterStyle method to register a string property that supports inheritance and whose default value is an empty string (""). This incomplete example includes a public property, whose implementation accesses an element of this property by using the default indexer property of the base class. 

        public class CustomStyle : 
        System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style
        {
            private string themeNameKey;

            public CustomStyle(string name)
            {
                themeNameKey = 
                    RegisterStyle(name, typeof(String), 
                        String.Empty, true).ToString();
            }
            
            public string ThemeName
            {
                get
                {
                    return this[themeNameKey].ToString();
                }
                set
                {
                    this[themeNameKey] = value;
                }
            }
        }

        Public Class CustomStyle
        Inherits System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style
        Private themeNameKey As String

        Public Sub New(ByVal name As String)
            themeNameKey = _
                RegisterStyle(name, GetType(String), _
                    String.Empty, True).ToString()
        End Sub
        
        Public Property ThemeName() As String
            Get
                Return Me(themeNameKey).ToString()
            End Get
            Set(ByVal value As String)
                Me(themeNameKey) = value
            End Set
        End Property
    End Class
  • SaveViewState()

    Saves the changes to the view state to an Object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected object SaveViewState ();

    Returns

    • System.Object

      The object that contains the view state.

  • TrackViewState()

    Turns on the tracking of view state in the Style object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected void TrackViewState ();

    Remarks

    This method sets the IsTrackingViewState property to true. It also calls the TrackViewState method on the StateBag object referenced by the State property.

      System.Object

    For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IStateManager.SaveViewState*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
